intro: Pavetta bechuanensis, commonly known as the Bechuanaland pavetta, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals, and it produces small, dark blue berries. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
